intro: Cadetia goliathensis, commonly known as the giant rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Cadetia goliathensis is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy species that thrives in well-drained soils.
